page.title: 08Biggleswade Hospital.
page.content: The hospital is situated in Potton Road.It was founded before 1900. It was first built as an isolation hospital. The hospital is now used for long stay elderly patients. It has forty six patients, thirty four nurses, twelve domestic staff and four kitchen staff. There are three wards in the hospital: the Whitbread Ward, named after the Whitbread family; has twenty patients; the Halsey Ward, named after a local naval man who aided George V;has twelve men; and the Linsal Ward, named after a local man; has fourteen women patients. The hospital only takes local people from Biggleswade, Potton,Sandy and Shefford. At the hospital there are nurses quarters but no nurses live on the premises now.
